bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: some desktop plasma components show error: Error loading Applet: package inexistent. Could not find requested component: org.kde.plasma.systemtray
other plasma components which fail: org.kde.plasma.comic some work: virtual desktop viewer, taskbar, clock
no plasma component (both working and not) accepts right-click (only left-click works) ie no desktop background menu, no chance to change or interact with all plasma components
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): updates-testing enabled - only show some packages below kdeplasma-addons-5.7.1-1.fc24.x86_64 plasma-workspace-common-5.7.1-2.fc24.x86_64 plasma-workspace-5.7.1-2.fc24.x86_64 plasma-integration-5.7.1-1.fc24.x86_64 kf5-plasma-5.24.0-1.fc24.x86_64 plasma-desktop-5.7.1-1.fc24.x86_64

Which kf5-plasma version do you have installed? I ran into the same issue yesterday, an upgrade to 5.24.0 fixed the problem. Unfortunately kf5 5.24.0 was unpushed and then pushed again.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-4701636a74

Are you suggesting I reinstall kf5-plasma package? because I might have gotten the un-pushed version.
I have another system with the same versions, which works as normal.
I have kf5-plasma-5.24.0-1.fc24.x86_64 installed - the pushed or un-pushed?

I don't know what the difference is. On my broken system I still had 5.23.0 due to the unpush (while you have 5.24?). On two other systems I upgraded before everything works fine too... After upgrading the broken one to 5.24.0 everything is fine there.
@Rex Dieter: You unpushed, edited and then pushed the update again. What are the changes?

I just did a reinstall of kf5-plasma package alone, and everything is working again :-))
Thanks!

Re: why was kf5 unpushed?
To prevent kf5-5.24.0 going stable due to autokarma (we want it to go stable at the same time as plasma-5.7.x). I saw no "revoke" option, so ...
